author: 熊狸 @bigeagle_xd
text:
I've been suffering from a "Cathedral vs Bazaar" issue since K2-0711.

In 2024, when working on closed models, we update the model every month, sometimes even make weekly hotfixes. The model was named as "kimi-latest", and we can easily improve the model based on instant feedbacks from real-user usage.  The iterations are smooth, relaxed and fast.

K2 was a breaking change, every update is public, and we have to put 120% effort in pre-release designing, training, testing, etc., and untested issues always show up after each release.

Here is the paradox, that open-sourcing actually slowed down the iterations, and I don't think it's practical to follow the Bazaar development model in current open-source AI models.

Any ideas? How about a beta/preview version (maybe only available on the official API) before each release?
